intro: Melocactus pedernalensis subsp. caloxanthus, commonly known as the golden yellow melocactus, is a rare and striking cactus native to the dry regions of Argentina. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stem and a dense covering of golden to orange spines, which give it its distinctive appearance. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the summer months, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in controlled settings to ensure its conservation.
